ygData.subject: Re: Sheet Metal
ygData.msgSnippet: as far as I know we cannot make sheets, I hope we can Im just missing something here. ... From: Robert DiFranco  To:
ygData.messageBody:
as far as I know we cannot make sheets, I hope we can Im just missing
something here.
----- Original Message -----
From: Robert DiFranco <pleezer@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, July 11, 1999 1:00 PM
Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Sheet Metal


> From: Robert DiFranco <pleezer@...>
>
> Heyas,
> I am a fairly new smith on Innoruuk, my skill is currently at 92. Here
is my
> question. At what skill level should I expect a high enough success rate
on
> making sheets that I can stop dragging sheets from Freeport , and just by
ore in
> HighHold. Those little buggers in Rivervale need armor, but I cannot find
sheets
> anywhere near them.
>
>
> Thanks Nagol
>
> Robert Fouts wrote:
>
> > From: "Robert Fouts" <mattrim@...>
> >
> > > 1) you're driving smiths away; it's not worth their
> > > time anymore. But I know, you think this is good
> > > because you get more business.
> > >
> > > 2) you 'teach' the buyers they don't have to pay more
> > > than rock-bottom prices. But again, you think this is
> > > good because you get more business, because you're
> > > happy making a few gold over cost.
> >
> > Take a look at this, thne think about it for a bit. Seems sort of like
the
> > real world doesn't it? I don't know about you, but where I come from
there
> > are always people willing to make a bit less of a profit, and just do
more
> > sales. Puts me a bit in mind of Kmart, Wallmart, Circit City, etc. etc.
> > etc. And not only these giants have been able to make a living by
selling
> > low, there are plenty of mom and pop stores that do the same, usualy
with
> > these smaller shops you get a bit less for your money, usualy in less of
a
> > customer service ability, little or no warranty, etc. Luckily in EQ
> > customer serveice isn't a problem... at least INSIDE the game, since
things
> > don't break down.
> >
> > > 3) you flood the market, so everyone has banded, so
> > > very soon, the server has all the banded it needs.
> > >
> > > This is the one I laugh about, because you're too
> > > shortsighted to understand it. When everyone has
> > > banded, you log on and auction you're selling it, and
> > > everyone shrugs because they already have what they
> > > want.
> >
> > Oh I just love this, especially after I spent the last three days trying
to
> > find Large Banded for my new character, and ended up paying every cent I
had
> > on two pieces of Bronze because NO ONE, answered my auctions about
looking
> > to buy banded. You know why it's such a pain to get banded nowadays?
> > Because of the people you are speaking of, the ones that make banded
> > unprofitable for many smiths. Looks to me like they are doing a great
job
> > of cornering the market.
> >
> > Rob
> > ~Chaos, panic, & disorder-my work here is done.~
> >

> >

> > http://www.onelist.com
> > Are you? If not, see our homepage for details.
